byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Karam Shoumali from Izmir and Gaziantep, Turkey.

abstract: Turkey, responding to pressure from United States and Europe, is taking steps to tighten its borders, stemming flow of refugees, foreign fighters and smugglers from Syria and elsewhere; American and European leaders have charged that porous borders fuel Syrian war and help extremist groups like Islamic State, but some rights groups have criticized treatment of refugees under stricter system.
lead_paragraph: Under growing pressure from Europe and the United States, the country has worked to cut off flows of refugees and foreign fighters.

headline.main: Turkey Moves to Clamp Down on Border, Long a Revolving Door
headline.print_headline: Turkey Moves to Clamp Down on Its Borders

snippet: Under growing pressure from Europe and the United States, the country has worked to cut off flows of refugees and foreign fighters.
